#### Request for Information – Flight Deck Motion System for Royal Canadian Navy Helicopter Carrying Ships
---

The Department of National Defence invites you to participate in a Request for Information (RFI) for the Flight Deck Motion System (FDMS) for the Royal Canadian Navy helicopter carrying ships. This RFI aims to provide an update to industry on the projected schedule for the FDMS Request for Proposal (RFP) and to inform industry of the availability of FDMS Technical Information prior to the Draft RFP release.

**No Obligation to Respond**
Please note that this RFI is not a formal call for tender or a Request for Proposal (RFP). No agreement or contract will be entered into based on this RFI. Participation in this RFI is voluntary and no responses are mandatory. This RFI is not a condition or prerequisite for participating in any future solicitation.

**Schedule of Events**
Below are the current high-level scheduling events:

| Event | Date |
| --- | --- |
| Draft RFP posted with Industry Day | Q2 2023 |
| Formal RFP posted on Buy and Sell | Q4 2023 |
| Contract Award | Q1 2024 |

**Access to FDMS Technical Information**
Prospective bidders are informed of the opportunity to access a standardized FDMS technical information package containing Defence Research and Development Canada (DRDC) intellectual property. To access this information, please visit the [ISED Explore IP website](https://ised-isde.canada.ca/ipm-mcpi/patent-brevet/) and type "FDMS" in the search box. Following registration and completion of a Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA), DRDC will share the technical information package.

**Contact Information**
For any questions or clarification, please contact:

Abdallah Attar, Material Acquisition and Support Specialist, Canadian Surface Combatant Project (CSC)
Department of National Defence
abdallah.attar@forces.gc.ca | 343-543-4305

**Closing Date for RFI**
This RFI will remain open on Buy and Sell until November 30th, 2022, 4 PM (EST). No formal responses to this RFI are expected. Participate to stay informed of developments related to the FDMS RFP.
